intro: Sesamothamnus erlangeri, commonly known as the Erlanger's sesamothamnus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically arranged in dense clusters. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
